15589: GT uses COUNT without DISTINCT in JOIN; question asks 'how many users', not user-post pairs
6734: GT COUNT(Diagnosis) counts lab records not distinct patients. SLE has 9 patients vs RA's 6 — SLE IS most common
6825: GT COUNT(*) = 7 records, but only 6 distinct patients. Question asks 'how many of them' (patients)
6940: GT COUNT(*) = 4 records from 1 patient. Question asks 'how many' (patients)
4451: GT ORDER BY q2 ASC puts NULL first; Fisichella has no Q2 time but sorts as 'best'
4452: Same as 4451 — Fisichella's NULL Q2 time sorts as 'best' lap time
6075: GT sorts DESC for 'lowest potential' question — returns highest potential players instead
2323: GT queries set_translations table, but question asks about cards
2418: GT checks set-level Korean translation; model correctly checks card-level foreign_data
279: GT doesn't filter by rtype='S', includes district-level aggregates for 'school' question
3617: GT counts tag table entries (1 row), but question asks 'count the number of posts' (22 posts)
5450: GT returns 'id' (row ID in Player_Attributes), not player_api_id (actual player identifier)
660: GT JOINs client→district (client's location), but question asks about 'account branch' (account's district)
726: GT orders A4 (population number) as text; '93931' > '177686' lexicographically, getting wrong district
2896: GT JOINs votes→posts creating cross-product; 3 posts × 8 votes = 24 rows → 24/8=3.0 fake ratio. Real ratio: 3/8=0.375
7721: GT JOINs through yearmonth table, multiplying by ~20 months. Real total: 3437.01, GT inflated: 68740.2
15642: GT SUM(wins) from driverStandings includes cumulative career wins. Schumacher won 3 races at Sepang, not 16
1304: Toxicology 3-table JOIN inflates average to 732.125 single bonds/molecule (only 343 total molecules)
1757: GT counts % of bonds that are triple (0.049%). Question asks about '% of compounds' — should count molecules (1.17%)
1852: GT counts 442 but only 343 molecules exist. GT doesn't join to molecule table, counts orphaned bond records
1400: GT counts molecules with any non-F atom (all of them). Doesn't properly identify fluorine-free molecules
1936: GT returns 100% but TR377 (non-carcinogenic) also has H atoms + triple bonds. Correct answer: 50%
2020: GT SELECT COUNT(type) counts cards (12 rows), not distinct types. Claim says 'distinct card types' — only 4 exist
2018: Same as 2020 — GT counts card rows, not distinct types. Only 2 distinct types via the 'types' column
6160: GT computes % of under-180cm players with strength>70 (40.7%). Claim says '% of players' — model correctly computed 13.9% of ALL
4950: GT GROUP BY + LIMIT 1 returns one constructor's count (2), not 'how many constructors' have 2 races
5441: GT uses inclusive BETWEEN 60 AND 65, but claim says 'up to but not including 65'. Self-contradicting claim
5325: GT sorts by time string with broken CASE parsing. Returns 2:00.000 but fastest lap is 1:07.411 (67411 ms)
5324: Same as 5325 — GT time parsing returns wrong result
15629: Age changes over time. Kobayashi is now 40 (confirmed by both GT SQL and model SQL), claim says 39
632: 315 accounts share the earliest 1995 date. Claim says account 9 is 'the only' one
4154: 40 heroes tied at Speed=100. GT returns Air-Walker (alphabetically). Silver Surfer also has 100
5828: GT denominator COUNT(t1.id) includes NULL-rating rows, deflating average. Correct avg: 70.4, GT gives 69 via int division
5023: Off by 3 (24462 vs 24465). GT parses time strings; model uses milliseconds (more reliable)
6038: GT joins Player.id=Match.id (row IDs, semantically wrong). Model correctly uses home/away player columns
802: GT counts disp.type != 'OWNER' (non-owner dispositions = 74), not accounts without cards. Model correctly found 296 accounts without cards
6995: GT 3-way JOIN Patient-Laboratory-Examination creates cross-product: 1 patient × 7 rows = COUNT 7. Only 1 distinct patient
6722: GT counts rows (1630) not distinct patients (140). Question asks 'how many patients'. Also uses inclusive boundary
5489: Rangers/Celtic tied at 11 away wins. GT says Celtic; claim says Rangers. Both achieved the max
15831: Registration/Yearly Kickoff tied at 30 attendees. GT picks Yearly Kickoff
2587: Ties at boundary of top 10 cards by mana cost
5576: Fernando Morientes is 10th but ordering around ties differs
6975: Claim says '14 patients' but GT counts 14 lab-examination records from 1 distinct patient
2290: Hint formula gives 100% (115/115 textless cards are normal), but GT SQL computes 0.2% (115/56822 of all cards). Hint contradicts GT SQL
16103: Hint says MAX(cost), but GT SQL uses SUM(cost). Model followed hint correctly; benchmark penalizes it
5607: Claim references Haaland but player doesn't exist in DB (data ends 2016, Haaland debuted 2019). Model correctly said NEI
16378: gasstations table has no 'services' column. Whether a station 'offers' car wash is inferred from transactions. GT marks OUT-OF-SCHEMA but model found a reasonable proxy
461: Model used GSoffered column instead of GSserved. Question asks 'grade span served' but claim says 'configuration'
1236: Model interpreted 'oldest AND lowest salary' as exact intersection of two extremes. GT uses combined ORDER BY ranking
1842: Model didn't join to molecule table, counting orphaned molecule_ids (370 > 343 total molecules). Should have used INNER JOIN
1144: Model filtered to only outgoing payments (VYDAJ=143545) but 'aggregate payments' means all transactions (303276 > 250000). Missed the contradiction
